sen.j: 乃木神社（のぎじんじゃ）は、明治時代に活躍した軍人、乃木希典を祀った神社。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrine is the Shinto shrine which deifies Maresuke NOGI who played an active role as a prominent military officer in Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 「軍人」は定訳より、military officerの方が一般的かと思います。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrine is the Shinto shrine which deifies Maresuke NOGI who played an active role as a prominent military officer in Meiji period.
Nogi-jinja Shrine is the Shinto shrine which deifies Maresuke NOGI who played an active role as a prominent military officer in Meiji period.

sen.j: 日本国内に複数の乃木神社がある。
sen.e: There are several Nogi-jinja Shrines in Japan.
There are several Nogi-jinja Shrines in Japan.
There are several Nogi-jinja Shrines in Japan.

sen.j: 乃木の出身地の下関市や別邸のあった那須塩原市など、乃木ゆかりの地に多い。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrines are primarily located in the places which are associated with NOGI: Shimonoseki City where he was from: Nasushiobara City where he owned a villa as his second residence.
Nogi-jinja Shrines are primarily located in the places which are associated with NOGI: Shimonoseki City where he was from, and Nasushiobara City where he owned a villa as his second residence.
Nogi-jinja Shrines are primarily located in the places which are associated with Nogi: Shimonoseki City where he was from, and Nasushiobara City where he owned a villa as his second residence.

sen.j: 乃木神社のある栃木県内に同じ読みの野木神社があるが、由来は全く異なる（野木神社は伝承によれば4世紀ごろ創立）。
sen.e: In addition to Nogi-jinja Shrine related to NOGI, there is another Nogi-jinja Shrine in the same Tochigi Prefecture; however, in spite of having phonetically the same names, they are the different schools of shrine with different backgrounds (According to tradition, it is believed that the different school of Nogi-jinja Shrine was built around the forth century).
sen.cmt: 外国人にわかりやすくするために、英文の冒頭に説明「乃木大将にゆかりのある乃木神社に加えて」をつけました。
sen.e: In addition to Nogi-jinja Shrine related to NOGI, there is another Nogi-jinja Shrine in the same Tochigi Prefecture; however, in spite of having phonetically the same names, they are from different schools of shrines with different backgrounds (According to tradition, it is believed that the different school of Nogi-jinja Shrine was built around the forth century).

In addition to Nogi-jinja Shrine related to Nogi, there is another Nogi-jinja Shrine in the same Tochigi Prefecture; however, in spite of having phonetically the same names, they are from different schools of shrines with different backgrounds (According to tradition, it is believed that the different school of Nogi-jinja Shrine was built around the forth century).

sen.j: ただし、乃木希典は自身の姓と読みの同じ野木神社を特別な神社だと考え、数回参拝したほか奉納も行っているので、全く無関係というわけでもない。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the different Nogi-jinja Shrine is sometimes associated with Maresuke NOGI, for he visited the shrine to pray for a couple of times and also gave some dedication services there, since he regarded it as a special shrine whose name was phonetically the same as his family name.
sen.cmt: 日本文では二重否定ですが、英文に直訳すると不自然になるので、肯定文で訳しました。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the other Nogi-jinja Shrine is sometimes associated with Maresuke NOGI, as he had visited the shrine to pray a couple of times and also gave some dedication services there, since he regarded it as a special shrine whose name was phonetically the same as his family name.

Nevertheless, the other Nogi-jinja Shrine is sometimes associated with Maresuke NOGI, as he had visited the shrine to pray a couple of times and also gave some dedication services there, since he regarded it as a special shrine whose name was phonetically the same as his family name.

sen.j: 乃木神社 (那須塩原市)（栃木県那須塩原市） -- 日清戦争後に乃木が閑居した別邸の敷地内にある。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrine (Nasushiobara City) (Nasushiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture) -- It is located within the site of the villa where NOGI lived in retirement after Shino-Japanese War.
Nogi-jinja Shrine (Nasushiobara City) (Nasushiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture) -- It is located within the site of the villa where NOGI lived in retirement after Shino-Japanese War.
Nogi-jinja Shrine (Nasushiobara City) (Nasushiobara City, Tochigi Prefecture) -- It is located within the site of the villa where Nogi lived in retirement after Shino-Japanese War.
It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) in the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) according to the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) according to the old classification of shrines.

sen.j: 乃木神社 (京都市)（京都市伏見区） -- 明治天皇陵の麓にある。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja (Kyoto City) (Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City) -- It is located around the foot of the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji.
Nogi-jinja (Kyoto City) (Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City) -- It is located around the foot of the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji.
Nogi-jinja (Kyoto City) (Fushimi Ward, Kyoto City) -- It is located around the foot of the Imperial mausoleum of Emperor Meiji.
It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) in the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) according to the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) according to the old classification of shrines.

sen.j: 乃木神社 (下関市)（山口県下関市） -- 下関市長府は乃木の郷里である。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja (Shimonoseki City) (Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) -- Chofu, Simimoseki City is the place where NOGI came from.
Nogi-jinja (Shimonoseki City) (Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) -- Chofu, Simimoseki City is the place where NOGI came from.
Nogi-jinja (Shimonoseki City) (Shimonoseki City, Yamaguchi Prefecture) -- Chofu, Shimonoseki City is the place where Nogi came from.
sen.cmt: 人名修正しました。スペル修正しました。

sen.e: It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) in the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) in the old classification of shrines.
It was ranked as the prefectural shrine (of prefectures other than Kyoto and Osaka) in the old classification of shrines.

sen.j: 乃木神社 (東京都港区赤坂） -- 乃木夫妻が自刃した邸宅の隣地にある。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrine (Minato Ward, Tokyo) (Minato Ward, Tokyo, Akasaka (Tokyo), (Minato Ward, Tokyo)) -- It is located next to the residence where Mr. and Mrs. NOGI fell on their swords.
Nogi-jinja Shrine (Minato Ward, Tokyo) (Minato Ward, Tokyo, Akasaka (Tokyo), (Minato Ward, Tokyo)) -- It is located next to the residence where Mr. and Mrs. NOGI fell on their swords.
Nogi-jinja Shrine (Akasaka, Minato Ward, Tokyo) -- It is located next to the residence where Mr. and Mrs. Nogi fell on their swords.
sen.cmt: 原文の所在地をサイトに合わせ修正し、訳文も修正しました。人名修正しました。

sen.j: 旧社格は府社で、現在は神社本庁の別表神社。
sen.e: It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) in the old classification of shrines before; however, it is one of the shrines on the exceptional list (Beppyo-jinja shrine) of The Association of Shinto Shrines in the present.

It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) in the old classification of shrines before; however, it is one of the shrines on the exceptional list (Beppyo-jinja shrine) of The Association of Shinto Shrines in the present.

It was ranked as Fusha (the prefectural shrine of either Kyoto or Osaka) in the old classification of shrines before; however, it is one of the shrines on the exceptional list (Beppyo-jinja shrine) of The Association of Shinto Shrines in the present.

sen.j: 北海道函館市乃木町に分社がある。
sen.e: There is a branch shrine of Nogi-jinja Shrine in Nogi Town, Hakodate City, Hokkaido.
There is a branch shrine of Nogi-jinja Shrine in Nogi Town, Hakodate City, Hokkaido.
There is a branch shrine of Nogi-jinja Shrine in Nogi-cho, Hakodate City, Hokkaido.

sen.j: 大正5年に独立の函館乃木神社として創建され、昭和39年に東京の乃木神社に寄進されて函館分社となった。
sen.e: The branch shrine was originally built as an independent Hakodate Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1916, and when it was donated to Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1964, it became Hakodate Branch of Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine.

The branch shrine was originally built as an independent Hakodate Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1916, and when it was donated to Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1964, it became the Hakodate Branch of Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine.

The branch shrine was originally built as an independent Hakodate Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1916, and when it was donated to Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine in 1964, it became the Hakodate Branch of Tokyo Nogi-jinja Shrine.

sen.j: 香川縣護國神社（香川県善通寺市）内 乃木神社 -- 香川縣護國神社とともに「讃岐宮」と称される。
sen.e: Nogi-jinja Shrine in the site of Kagawa-ken Prefecture Gokoku-jinja Shrine (Zentsuji City, Kagawa Prefecture) -- The shrine is called "Sanuki no miya Shrine," so is Kagawa-ken Prefecture Gokoku-jinja Shrine.
